history.content: Hi, Prof. Vazirani discussed this at his advising session and said that it is unlikely it will be offered again in the near future. I would suggest his archived course, which has insanely high reviews: https://www.edx.org/course/quantum-mechanics-quantum-computation-uc-berkeleyx-cs-191x. Since you are a freshman, I am presuming you haven't taken any quantum mechanics classes yet, but if you get around to it, I recommend Chem 120A if you are more application-oriented. If you are still interested, you can email him and eventually try to take his grad class if he offers it.

children.subject:
Trying to self-teach myself quantum computing, I would find it completely impossible to understand without Physics 137A.

Nielsen and Chuang is a good reference.

Let me know if you're self-studying, we can exchange notes.

history.content:
I am a freshman who is interested in learning more about quantum computing. In case this class comes up in the future, I want to be prepared. For those who have taken the class, would you recommend taking Physics 137A and/or B to prepare for the class or supplement the material?

Thanks!
history.subject: CS C191 Background Info
